com.gej.object

Class GObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.object.GObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updateable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AngularGObject, DirectionedGObject

    public class GObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updateable
    This class represents objects in a game. Any object must extend this class. The events are automatically managed if this object is dynamically loaded through a map loader. Else you have to detect them on your own. This is an example object. 
     public class MyObject extends GObject {
 
     public MyObject(float x, float y) {
         super(Game.loadImage("<image>"));
         setX(x);
         setY(y);
     }
 
     public void update(long elapsedTime){
         // Update this object
     }
 
     public void collision(GObject other){
         // Another object has been collided
         if (other instanceof MyObject2) {
             // Other is MyObject2
         }
     }
 
 }
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        Returns the direction of this object. The angles are as followed. 
         0°   : moving upwards
 90°  : moving right or stationary
 180° : moving down
 270° : moving left

      • isTopCollision

        public boolean isTopCollision(GObject other)
        Checks if an object has collided this on top. Like in this example 
         ---------
 |       |
 | Other |
 |       |
 -----+--+------
      |        |
      |  this  |
      |        |
      ----------
        Parameters:
        other - The other object
        Returns:
        True if collision on top

      • isBottomCollision

         ----------
 |        |
 |  This  |
 |        |
 -----+---------+
      |         |
      |  Other  |
      |         |
      -----------
        Parameters:
        other - The other object
        Returns:
        True if bottom wise collision

 |         +-----------
 |  Other  |          |
 |         |   This   |
 ----------|          |
           ------------
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • bounce

        public void bounce(GObject other)
        This object bounces back from the other object in a natural way. Please realize that the bounce is not completely accurate because this depends on many properties. But in many situations the effect is good enough. Had some bugs in pixel perfect detection mode if the image has a larger area of complete alpha. If using PPCD, make the object fit the image size by removing the alpha and resizing the image.

      • getNextX

        public float getNextX()

      • moveToContact

        public void moveToContact(GObject other)
        Moves this object to the next point which on next move would collide. Works perfectly only in the pixel perfect collision detection mode. This automatically resets the velocities.
        Parameters:
        other - The other object

      • moveToContact

        public void moveToContact(GObject other,
                 boolean horizontal,
                 boolean vertical)
        Moves this object to the next point which on next move would collide. Works perfectly only in the pixel perfect collision detection mode. This automatically resets the velocities.
        Parameters:
        other - The other object
        horizontal - Should move horizontally?
        vertical - Should move vertically?
